config.segmentationDefinition: Segment the video into stories or chapters. A story (chapter) in a video is a self-contained portion of the program dedicated to a specific news story, topic, or theme. Each segment typically includes a distinct introduction, development, and (sometimes) a conclusion, and can feature a combination of elements such as reporter narration, interviews, sound bites, relevant footage (B-roll), and graphics.

SegmentType.description: The short title or a short summary of the story or chapter.

Description.description: A five-word description of the scene. A scene is a smaller segment of the segment where a continous block for storytelling unfolds within a specific time, place, and set of characters. A scene can only belong to a single chapter, and cannot overlap with other scenes. Scenes are sequential across the video.

StartTimestamp.description: the start timestamp of the scene

EndTimestamp.description: the end timestamp of the scene
